meanings.definition: To deprive of possession or ownership.
meanings.sent1: The landlord dispossesses the tenant of the apartment.
meanings.sent2: The government dispossesses the family of their home due to unpaid taxes.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf dispossesses the grumpy troll of his favorite rock.
meanings.sent4: Failure dispossesses you of your dreams if you let it.
meanings.sent5: The storm dispossesses the trees of their leaves, leaving them bare and vulnerable.

meanings.definition: To evict or oust from property or land.
meanings.sent1: The bank dispossesses the homeowners for failing to pay the mortgage.
meanings.sent2: The new owner dispossesses the old tenants to renovate the building.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel dispossesses the birds from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: Fear can dispossess you of your courage if you let it control you.
meanings.sent5: The conqueror dispossesses the defeated army of their weapons and armor.
